body:
Repro steps:
1. Open some Flutter app in IntelliJ
2. Start debugging
3. Once the app has started, click the 'restart' button fast 5-10 times in a row

Result:

This crash:

```
Starting device daemon...
Launching loader on Nexus 5X...
--------- beginning of main
Observatory listening on http://127.0.0.1:8100
Diagnostic server listening on http://127.0.0.1:8101
Synced 8.3MB.
Connected to _flutterView/0xdb11b090.
Running lib/main.dart on Nexus 5X...
Application running.
Error from flutter daemon: Bad state: Future already completed
```

comment_data.body: Is this really something that needs to be in the 0.1 milestone?
Do you mean the `Full Application Restart` button? When I click that one several times I do not see this problem (but I do get another, so it needs work).

Yes, I mean 'Full application restart'. Sometimes I need to click many times. But sometimes just two clicks with like half a second in between hits this. I seem to hit it more often when using a physical Android device than when using the iOS simulator.

After that the only remedy is to restart IJ, so pretty severe.

I have code to fix this mostly written but I can't commit it until https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/6400 is fixed. See https://github.com/flutter/flutter-intellij/tree/enablement. I still need to tune the code that detects when to enable the buttons, and that depends on getting 6400 fixed.

I did see this sort of crash occur. I was able to recover by stopping the flutter app and restarting it. I did not have to restart IJ.
Tentatively moving to the current (`0.1.5`) milestone.
We do have an `app.started` event now, and will soon have better information about when a restart is in progress (well named `app.progress` events).

FWIW I verified that we still have issues with head:

```
 No consumer associated with id: 
java.lang.Throwable
    at com.intellij.openapi.diagnostic.Logger.error(Logger.java:127)
    at com.jetbrains.lang.dart.ide.runner.server.vmService.DartVmServiceDebugProcessZ$2.logError(DartVmServiceDebugProcessZ.java:176)
    at org.dartlang.vm.service.VmServiceBase.processResponse(VmServiceBase.java:411)
    at org.dartlang.vm.service.VmServiceBase$1.onMessage(VmServiceBase.java:99)
    at de.roderick.weberknecht.WebSocketReceiver.run(WebSocketReceiver.java:65)


java.lang.Throwable
    at com.intellij.openapi.diagnostic.Logger.error(Logger.java:127)
    at com.jetbrains.lang.dart.ide.runner.server.vmService.DartVmServiceDebugProcessZ$2.logError(DartVmServiceDebugProcessZ.java:176)
    at org.dartlang.vm.service.VmServiceBase.processResponse(VmServiceBase.java:411)
    at org.dartlang.vm.service.VmServiceBase$1.onMessage(VmServiceBase.java:99)
    at de.roderick.weberknecht.WebSocketReceiver.run(WebSocketReceiver.java:65)
```

(Note that this is before any enablement fixes.)

rename.to: update the enablement of the restart buttons (was: crash while restarting)

title: update the enablement of the restart buttons (was: crash while restarting)
